In addition to the locative verb míya, a set of posture verbs are used to express the location and existence of both human (53) and non-human (54) entities. These constructions express temporary existence at the time utterance rather than a permanent sense of existence. there are 'posture verbs' that indicate
semantic complement clause follows 'I think...' in 'I think the pig is (standing) down over there'
but topicalization is possible
nanu negates declarative clauses (withnominal and verbal predicate), tia negates imperatives
